name: Art On The Brain
description:
Discover the powerful work of over 40 artists living with the effects of brain injury.

This exhibition includes Come Fly With Me, a multimedia group installation featuring over 100 birds, created as a symbols of journey, odyssey, resilience, and transformation. 

Continue to explore by joining ornithologist and debut novelist Deborah M. Buehler and BIST artists for a talk, Come Fly With Me - Exploring the Representation of Birds In Art and Art Walk. Her novel, "Tiaris When the Oceans Kissed" draws on her academic expertise to reimagine the building of the Panama Canal through the eyes of a time travelling teenager. Engage in conversation about the enduring power of birds as symbols of freedom and transformation, and discuss why we continue to be drawn to these creatures in times of change and healing.

After the talk, enjoy a short break followed by an optional bird walk on the Cedar Ridge grounds.

name: Pride at CF Toronto Eaton Centre
description:
We're transforming into a vibrant hub for Pride Month celebrations.

From a stunning 40-foot Pride flag and rainbow centre court staircase to community-driven events, we will be adorned in the spirit of 2SLGBTQ+ pride through art, entertainment, and wonderful experiences.

Highlights include - Test Your Knowledge with Pride Trivia at Queen's Cross, CF Drag Brunch presented by OEB Breakfast Co. - A Feast for the Senses, celebration of Indigenous and Queer identity through art, promoting unity with Pride love messages, and CF Pride Shop - A Showcase of Queer Creativity.

name: Art On The Brain: Brain Injury Society of Toronto
description: Dive into the realities of brain injury, hidden disabilities and ableism with this exhibit from the Brain Injury Society of Toronto (BIST). Art On The Brain highlights the voices of artists working through grief, trauma and emotional struggles related to brain injury, adding raw depth to the collection. Some works vividly depict brains broken and damaged, while others subtly express emotions like loss, resilience and strength. The exhibit also features pieces that go beyond these themes, offering a full picture of the brain injury experience and empowering individuals to share whatâ€™s often unseen, while challenging ableism and giving space to their stories.

name: City Hall Pride Flag-Raising Celebration
description: Join the City of Toronto for a flag-raising celebration and official proclamation marking Pride Month. In a world facing growing challenges, the City stands strong in its unwavering commitment to 2SLGBTQI+ communities. Hear from Mayor Olivia Chow and Members of Council, and enjoy performances by Sanjina DaBish Queen, Trash Panda Brass, Tempo Choir and DJ Blackcat. Whether you're loud and proud or quietly fierce, come stand tall with your community in a city that uplifts all identities.

name: Monday Latin Nights with Latin Grooves and Dancing
description:
Hola mis amores! 
Tenemos una maravillosa noticia? You dreamed of a conversation table? 

Well we offer you an immersive experience to listen, practice and even dance your best Spanish and Portuguese language skills in our living room. Welcoming two Latin bands - one for dinner, one to make you dance.

We are an accessible venue with accessible washrooms.

name: Canvas and Bear Paint Pouring Workshop
description: Play with colours and patterns with this satisfying art technique. Let loose and express yourself in a fun and fluid way. Embrace the unpredictable patterns to create a one of a kind piece of art. No experience needed.

name: The Colours and Soul of Korea - Dancheong
description:
To mark the closing year of the Canada-Korea Year of Cultural Exchange (2024 - 2025), we are bringing the beauty and depth of traditional Korean art to Toronto. This landmark exhibition explores the rich heritage of Dancheong, a traditional Korean decorative painting technique used in temples and palaces.

 The opening reception features a lecture by a Dancheong expert and a traditional Korean music performance.

name: LA CUEVA - Flamenco Underground
description:
Experience the raw, wild, and deeply improvisational nature of flamenco. Acoustic and unamplified, come see this performance at its purest, most intense and most thrilling. Modelled off the flamenco tablaos in Granada, nestled into caves in the city's hillside, it is performed in the traditional Spanish manner, improvised and dynamic.

LA CUEVA showcases the city's most lauded and in-demand flamenco performers. Experience this art as it is rarely seen outside of Spain, all while sipping on wine and tasting specially prepared tapas.

name: Koffler Arts Presents Elinor Carucci and Hannah Altman
description: Curated by Toronto-based artist Barbara Astman, the exhibition by Elinor Carucci and Hannah Altman highlights the unique dynamic that exists between each artist's practice and their different life stages, exploring life from a Jewish feminist perspective, including womanhood, rituals, family, and the human condition.
